--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Ilja Preuss" <preuss@d...> wrote:
> jxingtang wrote:
> 
> > Well, I use Eclipse with JUB plugin to automatically generate 
Junit
> > test class. For each method being tested, only one corresponding
> > method in the test class will be generated.
> 
> Yes. But that's nonsense - don't use those automatically generated 
test
> methods.

It is still not too bad to have it generate test class template. Now 
it seems that we need to extend the template to include more test 
cases.

> 
> > However, for each method
> > being tested, there are quite a few test cases. Do I need to 
create a
> > new test method for each test case?
> 
> You do not really *need* to, but I would strongly advice you to do 
so.
> It makes maintaining the tests much easier.
> 

Actually I believe that it is common issue. Seldom a method has just 
one test case. 

> > Given the above code snippet as
> > example, do I need to separate DumpOutputTest into 
DumpOuputTestOne()
> > and DumpOutputTestTwo()? 
> 
> I'd rather name them after the behaviour you want to test. Possibly
> something along the lines of testDumpOutputForAbc and
> testDumpOutputForXyz. You can certainly find better names.
> 

I used One and Two just for illustration here. Your suggestion is 
still quite valuable for me.

Thanks a lot for your input!
